unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Deleting an S3 bucket can prevent legitimate users from accessing important data, aligning with the removal of access to resources.
Deleting an S3 bucket directly results in the destruction of data stored in that bucket, making this technique highly relevant.
Deleting an S3 bucket can serve as a method of removing evidence or logs that may be stored within the bucket, helping to evade detection.
Deleting an S3 bucket could result in a denial of service if critical data or services that rely on that bucket become unavailable.
If the S3 bucket is tied to a critical application or service, deleting it could effectively stop that service, aligning with this technique.
